data.description: Schedule should be in binary format (21 bytes). To configure, use the patterns: {index of the byte in array} = {day of the week} * 3 + ({hour} div 8); {value of the byte in array} |= 1 << ({hour} & 7). To add a schedule, use: {value of the byte in array} |= 1 << ({hour} & 7); where {index of the byte in array}: [0-20], {day of the week}: [0-6] 0 - Sun, 1 - Mon, and so on, {hour}: [0-23]

* 4 - Idle extended

* 1 - Process

* 2 - Script

* 4 - Document

* 7 - All

every.description:
[Deprecated]

* 0 - Every day

* 1 - Every weekday

* 2 - Every day of the weekend

firstRunTime.description: First run time (in seconds since 00:00:00 1 January 1970)

lastRunTime.description: Last run time (in seconds since 00:00:00 1 January 1970)

mode.description:
Run mode

* 0 - Manually

* 1 - By schedule

* 2 - Automatically

prepareStartDelta.description: Time interval between the remote computer in the local network wakes and the task starts (in ms)

raiseIfSkipped.description: Run scheduled scan on the next day if computer is turned off

startDelay.description: Postpone running after application startup for (in minutes)

type.description:
Type

* 0 - Minutes

* 1 - Hours

* 2 - Days

* 3 - Every week

* 4 - At a specified time

* 5 - Every month

* 6 - After application startup

* 7 - After every update

weekDays.description: Start on specific days of the week (to specify, follow the pattern: Mo=2^0, Tu=2^1, We=2^2, and so on. For example, Wednesday and Sunday: 2^2+2^6 = 68)

actionQuarantine.description: Move copy to Quarantine, delete object
If IOC is detected, move its copy to Quarantine and delete the object

iocScanArea.description:
IOC scan scope

* 0 - Critical file areas

* 1 - File areas on system drives of the device

iocScanScheduleMode.description:
Run IOC scan

* 0 - Manually

* 1 - After threat is detected

* 2 - Run when computer is idle

useTls.description: Use of TLS certificate for server

useTrafmonIncludes.description: Monitor all ports for specified applications

certificateStorage.description:
Certificate storage

* 0 - Use Windows Certificate Storage

* 1 - Use Mozilla Certificate Storage

checkMozillaProduct.description: Check secure traffic in Mozilla products

decodeSslWithEvCertificate.description: Decrypt encrypted connections with websites that use EV certificates

decodingErrorAction.description:
When encrypted connection scan errors occur

* 0 - Block connection

* 2 - Ignore

* 3 - Ask

decodingMode.description:
Scan encrypted connections

* 0 - No

* 1 - On request from component

embededScript.description: Inject script into web traffic to interact with web pages

invalidCertificateAction.description:

* 0 - Allow

* 1 - Block connection

limitTraffic.description: Limit traffic with a metered connection

* 3 - Deep scan

* 0 - Block download

* 22 - Nudism

sid.format: binary in Base64. See more https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64

data.description: Schedule should be in binary format (21 bytes). To configure, use the patterns: {index of the byte in array} = {day of the week} * 3 + ({hour} div 8); {value of the byte in array} |= 1 << ({hour} & 7). To add a schedule, use: {value of the byte in array} |= 1 << ({hour} & 7); where {index of the byte in array}: [0-20], {day of the week}: [0-6] 0 - Sun, 1 - Mon, and so on, {hour}: [0-23]
data.format: binary in Base64. See more https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64
